analysis

myutils.analysis.ramachandran(sith, pdb_file)[source]

Returns the ramachandran angles of several stretched configurations. each compoe

Parameters:

  • sith – sith object.

  • pdb_file – pdb file that contains the structural information. It doesn’t matter if the coordinates don’t correspond to something relevant. The importance are in the structural description (aminoacids, number of residue…)

myutils.analysis.distance(file, index1, index2)[source]

This code checks the distances between two atoms in the last configuration of a trajectory file (e.g. .log file from gaussian).

Parameters:

  • file (str) – name of the file that contains the trajectory.

  • index1 (int) – index of the first atom to compute distances

  • arg2 (int) – index of the second atom to compute distances

Returns:

  • (float) Distance between atoms corresponding with atom with index1 and

  • index2.

  • Execute from terminal using

  • myutils distance arg1 arg2 arg3

  • E.g.

  • myutils distance optimization.log 1 20

myutils.analysis.indexes_per_aminoacid(pdb_file)[source]
myutils.analysis.all_hydrogen_atoms(mol)[source]

” find the indexes of all the hydrogen atoms in the peptide from an ASE.Atoms object.

Parameters:

mol (string) – ASE.Atoms object to extract the hydrogen indexes.

Return type:

list of indexes.

myutils.analysis.dof_classificator(dofs_indexes, atoms_per_aminoacids)[source]

return all degrees of freedom defined by atoms of the same residue

myutils.analysis.dof_classificator2(dofs_indexes, atoms_per_aminoacids)[source]

Return all degrees of freedom that includes at least one atom of a residue

myutils.analysis.classical_energies(file)[source]

Return the classical energies in Hartrees

myutils.analysis.length_energy(sith, aminos_info, atoms_types)[source]

return the value of the DOF and the energies as the molecule is stretched

Parameters:

  • sith (sith object) –

  • aminos_info (dic) – amino_info.amino_info of the requiered amino acid.

  • atom_types – name of the atoms inside the aminoacid that will be studied, example [‘CA’, ‘CB’]

Return type:

myutils.analysis.extract_bonds(readable_file)[source]
myutils.analysis.diff_bonds(file1, file2, file='frozen_dofs.dat')[source]

This function returns the bonds that are in one file (first argument) but not in the other (second argument).
